website_summaries.verdict: If you love fresh, deep-fried fish, you will love this cooker. It also makes some mean Buffalo wings, shrimp, and other favorite fried foods.
pros: Comes with nice deep-frying basket with long handle that makes immersing food safe and efficient
Unit is easy and fast to assemble
Can be used in the comfort of your own backyard, while camping, and even tailgating
cons: Controlling the flame takes effort to get it just right for cooking at the right temp needed

customer_reviews.title: Great versitile cooker
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooker! We originally bought this to fry fish occasionally and it works great for that but I use it at least once a week to cook food that needs high heat like when using a (cheap) wok or searing steak in a large frying pan. The flame is great and puts out more heat that the 4 burners on our stove combined. The aluminum pot works well and is easy to clean even after frying (lots and lots of) whiting for close to 2 hours. Thermometer is good too. This was the best 50 bucks I spent this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Dutch

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the family
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It’s robust, and easy to build and take apart while traveling or storing. It does exactly what it’s supposed to, and we’ve fried some great fish, fries and onion rings with it. It’s been on a bunch of family vacations, tailgates, and back porch cooking days, and it’s never let us down. It’ll burn like the sun. I like the handy little thermometer too. I actually use it on my smoker sometimes, bc it’s real easy to clip on anywhere, and it’s pretty accurate. My wife is Cajun from Louisiana, she approves and so does my father in law. That’s good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie

customer_reviews.title: Great cooker
customer_reviews.text: Great burner easy to install and use. It cook the fried fish perfect. Love the price. I would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Bad regulator- Can’t use
customer_reviews.text: We just ordered this, put it together and attempted to use it last night to fry fish but the regulator would not attach completed to the propane tank. Gas was leaking out so we were not able to use it. Apparently the regulator is bad and I attempted to call the 800 number to remedy this, but all I get is a busy signal. Not a good sign of a reputable company or product. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: ... had this fryer for nearly a year and have loved it. I use it with peanut oil on ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this fryer for nearly a year and have loved it. I use it with peanut oil on fries, onion rings, chicken wings. etc. It has received many compliments from satisfied family members and friends. It is standing up fine to the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Drill Sergeant

customer_reviews.title: Mia- informed
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying a new product, this most definitely was not knew. All boxes and packages had been opened and contents distributed all over the box. Plus box it arrived in was covered with excessive amount of clear tape. Had not had time to test but sure this had a previous owner. Perhaps it was returned to seller because it does not sit up very high
customer_reviews.author: john Kozel

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing Not Up to Par
customer_reviews.text: Never had a chance to use it. The threads for the propane gas line into the burner assembler were poorly tapped and thus the threads from the gas line didn’t actually thread into the burner unit. So, no go. Returning to after searching for an alternative and replacing with the same thing. Sometime you win, sometimes you lose. Lost this time...
customer_reviews.author: ABClark

customer_reviews.title: Sizzle
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size for frying fish etc. Works like a champ, a great value.
customer_reviews.author: MNAlan

customer_reviews.title: Great Fish Fryer
customer_reviews.text: We had a family reunion where we fried more than 30 pounds of fish. This fryer worked beautifully and held the temperature well. Clean up was very easy, too!
customer_reviews.author: Doris W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Just got our fryer, put it together, nice and simple to do. Ironically the sales pitch is "one screw per leg" i kind of wish it was two just for the sake of sturdiness. my only legitimate complaint is that the burner head once it's plugged into the gas line feels like it hangs down on an angle and doesn't lay flat anymore. It's nothing big, but i feel it could be remedied with a clip that kind of hangs from the black circular rim at the right height. Might make my own with a scrap of metal. All in all, REALLY happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Grant

customer_reviews.title: Hope your parts match the parts list, mine didn't
customer_reviews.text: Received this fryer today, when I assembled it I found that the instructions have different pieces then what I had in hand.. idk if they updated the fryer and not the instructions, but I'm starting to have doubts about this product
customer_reviews.author: queenbeeof3

customer_reviews.title: Oversized basket which is a plus and very sturdy. Somewhat difficult to assemble! A Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: It was somewhat difficult to assemble. But, once together it is great! Very well made and very sturdy! The basket is much larger than I expected, a definite plus! It cleans up super with detergent and hot water! The mesh basket plus the basket it sits inside of cleans great as they both fit in a double sink. In fact the basket, when placed in a double sink fits just right! Extremely pleased with how easy to clean. As I said, the basket and the mesh basket are extra large and can fry several pieces of fish easily! Very pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe#1

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Burner works fine but one leg folded under the meager weight and almost caused a major disaster!
customer_reviews.author: Eldon Walters

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect for the price! It gets the done done & well! It’s sturdy and the pot and strainer are good quality! You will not be disappointed with this! It’s strong enough to support the weight of a turkey if you use a bigger pot! This is so versatile! I might buy another as a gift!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chanel R. Massie

customer_reviews.title: Easy cooking.
customer_reviews.text: Got two. For our sons for Christmas. They have used them and like it.hubbies just came in, he had an old one but likes this one better
customer_reviews.author: Pippa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fathers Day Gift!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for a fish fry house warming party. The assembly was easy and the pot big enough to fry several pieces of fish or a pound of shrimp at one time. This made cooking and serving easy as fish gets cold quickly. Clean up wasn’t difficult but it is a deep fryer. Perfect height to monitor cooking progress.
customer_reviews.author: bodhiegirl

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fry chicken for a grad party and it worked perfectly. I'm very happy with the purchase.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Fries a whole chicken at once!
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built product; safe and easy to use & clean. I haven't tried fish yet but I've done chicken several times very successfully.

customer_reviews.title: Good deep fryer for fish and wings
customer_reviews.text: Put this baby together and have been frying fish and wings ever since. I purchased an oil funnel and some filters with this, really helps with cleanup.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Bayou Classic 2212 Fish Cooker is amazing! I highly recommend this product!!!

customer_reviews.title: Haven't done much with it but seems sturdy and good.

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my cooker. It assembled in minutes. Our first meal cooked was chicken wings and the next night we fried fish. It was easy to use. The thermometer worked great and the clean up was easy.

customer_reviews.title: Good small fryer for the money
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a fish fry for a few people. I wish the handle for the pot fit tighter into the pot, I can’t hook it on the side and let oil drain etc, it just falls back in. But other than that, works as it should

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts

customer_reviews.title: Smells  awesome

customer_reviews.text: Stellar products which assembled very easily with all parts included. Connected to tank and good to go. Will purchase again.

customer_reviews.title: Low pressure, weak flame Over Priced
customer_reviews.text: I've have several cookers over the years, this is by far the most inefficient . Poor lp Flow for weak flame. Same your money and buy the Academy version.

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Missing nuts and washer....picture of the fryer looks nicer than actual. I had to buy my own parts for the basket handle. I called Mike Crodus quality outlet manager about assembly and missing parts. He's replied was nothing wrong with the product and my assembly is correct. I'm disappointed that he did not offer to send me the missing part.

customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cooker mainly for camping meals, and used it on a recent trip. It functioned ok, however the parts seem cheaply made. I could smell the paint burning off immediately when I started cooking. It rained during the trip and rust is already setting in. I doubt this item will last as well as the higher priced unit, that I have been using over the last five years.

The only issue I had is the size of the pot is a little small if your expecting to fry for guests. It clearly says the size, however, not any pot from home will fit in it.

I thought this fish cooker would be a great solution - new gadget for him, outdoor fish fry for me. He loves it! He said it works great. I also bought him a Cook's Choice Better Breader to go with it. I think he likes it even better!

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TO OWN IN AN EMERGENCY SITUATION
customer_reviews.text: Used one identical to this during long-term power outage. It made boiling water for washing dishes a breeze compared to heating it over a charcoal grill. Bought this one as a safety net in any future emergency situation. It's worth having when you need it.

customer_reviews.title: Must have

The only recomedation I have is that the gas regualtor does not seem to be a long lasting piece... in other words it is not robust. So, do no trust the regualator 100% when you finish the activities. Close the propane tank isolation valve in adition to the regulator valve as well. That way you will have double isolation.

customer_reviews.title: Bayou Classir Outdoor Fish Cooker Set
customer_reviews.text: The cooker was a great purchase. I used it for our community day. I easily cooked approx. 40-45 lbs of fried fish. This was my first time cooking with propane, but once I got the flame adjusted all went well. The set was very very easy to assemble with only a wrench needed to tighten the screws The directions that are included are easy to read and follow. Pay attention to the precautions re the propane, and also wear protective cooking glove when frying and removing food items from the cooker. Yes I recommend this fish cooker to others.

product_meta.title: Bayou Classic 2212 Fish Cooker Set, Black and Silver
product_meta.description:
"Amazon.com A heap of fresh-caught catfish deep-fries in no time in this outdoor fish cooker from Bayou Classic. The cooking set includes the single-burner gas stove itself, a 10-quart aluminum deep-fry pan, an aluminum perforated insert basket with handle, and a five-inch stainless-steel thermometer that helps maintain a safe cooking temperature for the oil. Some assembly is required for the stove, such as attaching the legs to the round frame. Designed for the utmost in safety, the stove features three legs that hold up to a 34-quart pot with no stress on the bolts. The cooking surface measures 12-3/4 inches in diameter, and a slight ridge keeps the pot from sliding off. From the ground to the top of the round frame, the cooker stands 19-1/2 inches tall. While a lid is not included with the 12-1/2-by-5-inch pot, the basket does come with a long steel handle (simple attaching required) that safely lowers and lifts the cooked food in or out of the hot oil. The thermometer features a pot clip and 1-3/4-inch dial that allows the cook to keep an eye on the temperature of the oil. A red zone is clearly marked for danger should the oil exceed 450 degrees F, at which point the heat source should be turned off immediately. Both Celsius and Fahrenheit are shown. Intended only for outdoor use, the cooker includes a UL-listed 10 PSI regulator, 29-inch hose, and a valve assembly. The pot also can be used indoors on a stovetop. Bayou Classic covers its cookers with a one-year warranty. --Ann Bieri What's in the Box 1 single-burner stove with regulator, hose, and valve assembly; 10-quart aluminum stockpot; aluminum perforated basket with handle; 5-inch stainless-steel thermometer. 4 items total. Product Description Bayou Classic Outdoor Fish Cookers are the traditional and reliable choice for outdoor cooking. They are portable and can be used for camping, rv's, tailgating, and backyard parties. Each component in Bayou Classic's Outdoor Fish Cookers is designed for strength, function and safety while remaining the most efficient systems sold."

AMAZON.COM
A heap of fresh-caught catfish deep-fries in no time in this outdoor fish cooker from Bayou Classic. The cooking set includes the single-burner gas stove itself, a 10-quart aluminum deep-fry pan, an aluminum perforated insert basket with handle, and a five-inch stainless-steel thermometer that helps maintain a safe cooking temperature for the oil. Some assembly is required for the stove, such as attaching the legs to the round frame. Designed for the utmost in safety, the stove features three legs that hold up to a 34-quart pot with no stress on the bolts. The cooking surface measures 12-3/4 inches in diameter, and a slight ridge keeps the pot from sliding off. From the ground to the top of the round frame, the cooker stands 19-1/2 inches tall. 

 While a lid is not included with the 12-1/2-by-5-inch pot, the basket does come with a long steel handle (simple attaching required) that safely lowers and lifts the cooked food in or out of the hot oil. The thermometer features a pot clip and 1-3/4-inch dial that allows the cook to keep an eye on the temperature of the oil. A red zone is clearly marked for danger should the oil exceed 450 degrees F, at which point the heat source should be turned off immediately. Both Celsius and Fahrenheit are shown. Intended only for outdoor use, the cooker includes a UL-listed 10 PSI regulator, 29-inch hose, and a valve assembly. The pot also can be used indoors on a stovetop. Bayou Classic covers its cookers with a one-year warranty. --Ann Bieri What's in the Box
1 single-burner stove with regulator, hose, and valve assembly; 10-quart aluminum stockpot; aluminum perforated basket with handle; 5-inch stainless-steel thermometer. 4 items total.

Tripod cooker features round 12-3/4-inch cooking surface, stands 19-1/2 inches tall
Pot measures 12-1/2 by 5 inches; handle attaches to basket; lid not included
Includes UL-listed regulator, 29-inch hose, valve assembly
Made for use with 20-pound LP gas cylinder (not included); 1-year warranty
